snippet: Good store. Had what I needed. Staff definitely helped when i realised my mistake at the self check out. They've got stairs etc to get to the store. They have a car park as well. Transport nearby.
A good store but to many people loitering about in car park and entrance.
A nice clean and inviting store. Stocks a full range of items. Also the staff were all friendly and helpful.
One of the waste service for the delivery drivers they not responding properly don't take orders for the store waste of time 😡🤬🤬🤬

The lady at the tills calling us to go to them was VERY rude and was shouting at people telling them to hurry up, Asking what they are doing and being very agressive towards all the customers. Don’t go here if u want to be abused by evil workers (Seriously though)

The staff and security guys in Abbey Wood Sainsbury’s are ridiculous and provide the worst experience! They stop my family, who was holding a crying baby, because they want to wait outside while I was paying at the checkout. The security search our shopping trolley without giving proper and rational reason. My family is not good at English could not stop him as he was holding a baby! The security claimed he was suspicious just because he exited at the “Exit” gate without buying anythin (because I did and I was paying!) and ignored our crying baby and stopped him from leaving. How considerate he was, it really disgusted me.
The other time was that the staff stopped me and my family after we complete the payment. She did just because we carried a big trolley but only buying a few pounds of products. Come on, what the heck!? How logical and educated their staff is! This shop didn’t allow their customers to shop from other shops before entering their shop! So, if you want to have an enjoyable shopping experience, never come to this shop again!
Parking is beneath the shop so lifts or travelator is necessary, not great if you just want to run in for 1 or 2 things! Otherwise standard Sainsbury's syore
I passed by as I only went to the shop under Bethel Mini-Mart to supply my Ginger Drink.
Lovely new Sainsbury's, just outside abbey wood train station. The store is bigger than it looks outside. It sells everything from clothes, home stuff and food. Great staff.

Helpful staff and good customer service apart from few exception. There are less staff for customer support, they are mostly busy to carry out some task, customer support on the shop floor seems very low in priority. This is basically same in all the supermarkets in the UK.

Close to the bus-stop and the train station. It has a big car park, bakery. The café is closed now.

ATM for US dollar and Euro and British pound.

They fixed the escalator but it comes with VERY ANOYING caution in mechanical voice and continuous beeping at the entrance.
--------
Over time the customer service is hitting the new low due to staff shortage or probably because of cost-saving attitude of the management.

Customers services all around the shop is sloppy. Due to shop reorganisation may products are moved. Firstly it is annoying if the products are not on the place where it supposed to be, secondly the employees are very reluctant to find the product , they will give the row number to find it. As if we go there to play games. Tills are closed ahead of time. I started to  fell indifferent about the shoplifters who exploits this system.

The management close the entrance what most customers use half an hour before closing time. Some staffs are rushing  around to go home, some are very vigorously refelling the shelf  before closing.
Aside from hating how you have to have a nectar card to pay normal prices. There's also the problem that they have one of most horrible smelling toilets in the country 🤢

Shop in there on a regular basis the store is great most of the staff are lovely but there's a few unhelpful and rude staff but the good ones outnumber them , my only complaint is parking issues the carpark is always used for the station it got worse when the Elizabeth line opened have to drive round trying to find a space usually right over the back which isn't great when you do a big shop why don't Sainsbury's stop this from happening.

Sadly this store gets more and more decrepit and shabby - escalator walkways regularly not working and take weeks to be repaired; lifts regularly not working; difficult if shopping as the store opens in the morning due to shelves / refrigerated areas all blocked for restocking and floor cleaner racing round at speed.  If a store opens at a certain time, then it should be open for business not for work which should be nearly finished on the shop floor.  I really feel sorry for staff as they are lovely, but they are working in an environment which is obviously not cared about.  As this is the only store within walking distance of hundreds of residents, I assume the community is considered a captive audience and no upkeep of the store is necessary as we don't have a choice.
It's a huge store, and with parking underneath what is not to like? It's great. Just remember your Nectar card!

Very bad experience the manger gurav he is very angry he don’t know how to talk he said am the manger I don’t have staff if you don’t have staff than close the store why you are working . No communication skills I don’t why he is here as a manager.

It is a large store with a large selection of household items, books, clothing, cleaning products and personal care, food, etc. The times I have visited the store, I have only met friendly employees and they have everything you need for everyday life and then some.

The toilets are so bad every time that I go. I have decided to start taking photos and upload them each time. I've missed a few, but it's so consistent that I'm sure there'll be plenty of them.
I either have to wait 10-15 minutes for my click and collect shopping, or, more likely, it will already be out, and my frozen items will have melted.
I have rocked up 10-15 minutes before closing a couple of times. Wanting to buy 1 or 2 items at the last minute. They close their doors early to stop people from getting in. They also make it super difficult to navigate in the last hour of being open.
Clearly badly managed. Feels like customers are burdens. The little interaction I've had with staff hasn't been great. Only use it because it's my closest superstore. Would love to have another option, as it would be pretty difficult to be worse than this.
Very large store, neat, spacious and staffed with polite people.

I just bought a steak pie by sainsbury's
When I goy it home its completely ruined the pie is smashed and the packaging is damaged like they all are in the shop I've found countless items broken or packaging damaged when I asked the manager about in December he told me not to come back again
No fridges or freezers working, no in store information about this problem before you start shopping. 24.072025
Good store. Had what I needed. Staff definitely helped when i realised my mistake at the self check out. They've got stairs etc to get to the store. They have a car park as well. Transport nearby.
A good store but to many people loitering about in car park and entrance.
A nice clean and inviting store. Stocks a full range of items. Also the staff were all friendly and helpful.
One of the waste service for the delivery drivers they not responding properly don't take orders for the store waste of time 😡🤬🤬🤬

The lady at the tills calling us to go to them was VERY rude and was shouting at people telling them to hurry up, Asking what they are doing and being very agressive towards all the customers. Don’t go here if u want to be abused by evil workers (Seriously though)

The staff and security guys in Abbey Wood Sainsbury’s are ridiculous and provide the worst experience! They stop my family, who was holding a crying baby, because they want to wait outside while I was paying at the checkout. The security search our shopping trolley without giving proper and rational reason. My family is not good at English could not stop him as he was holding a baby! The security claimed he was suspicious just because he exited at the “Exit” gate without buying anythin (because I did and I was paying!) and ignored our crying baby and stopped him from leaving. How considerate he was, it really disgusted me.
The other time was that the staff stopped me and my family after we complete the payment. She did just because we carried a big trolley but only buying a few pounds of products. Come on, what the heck!? How logical and educated their staff is! This shop didn’t allow their customers to shop from other shops before entering their shop! So, if you want to have an enjoyable shopping experience, never come to this shop again!
Parking is beneath the shop so lifts or travelator is necessary, not great if you just want to run in for 1 or 2 things! Otherwise standard Sainsbury's syore
I passed by as I only went to the shop under Bethel Mini-Mart to supply my Ginger Drink.
Lovely new Sainsbury's, just outside abbey wood train station. The store is bigger than it looks outside. It sells everything from clothes, home stuff and food. Great staff.

Helpful staff and good customer service apart from few exception. There are less staff for customer support, they are mostly busy to carry out some task, customer support on the shop floor seems very low in priority. This is basically same in all the supermarkets in the UK.

Close to the bus-stop and the train station. It has a big car park, bakery. The café is closed now.

ATM for US dollar and Euro and British pound.

They fixed the escalator but it comes with VERY ANOYING caution in mechanical voice and continuous beeping at the entrance.
--------
Over time the customer service is hitting the new low due to staff shortage or probably because of cost-saving attitude of the management.

Customers services all around the shop is sloppy. Due to shop reorganisation may products are moved. Firstly it is annoying if the products are not on the place where it supposed to be, secondly the employees are very reluctant to find the product , they will give the row number to find it. As if we go there to play games. Tills are closed ahead of time. I started to  fell indifferent about the shoplifters who exploits this system.

The management close the entrance what most customers use half an hour before closing time. Some staffs are rushing  around to go home, some are very vigorously refelling the shelf  before closing.
Aside from hating how you have to have a nectar card to pay normal prices. There's also the problem that they have one of most horrible smelling toilets in the country 🤢

Shop in there on a regular basis the store is great most of the staff are lovely but there's a few unhelpful and rude staff but the good ones outnumber them , my only complaint is parking issues the carpark is always used for the station it got worse when the Elizabeth line opened have to drive round trying to find a space usually right over the back which isn't great when you do a big shop why don't Sainsbury's stop this from happening.

Sadly this store gets more and more decrepit and shabby - escalator walkways regularly not working and take weeks to be repaired; lifts regularly not working; difficult if shopping as the store opens in the morning due to shelves / refrigerated areas all blocked for restocking and floor cleaner racing round at speed.  If a store opens at a certain time, then it should be open for business not for work which should be nearly finished on the shop floor.  I really feel sorry for staff as they are lovely, but they are working in an environment which is obviously not cared about.  As this is the only store within walking distance of hundreds of residents, I assume the community is considered a captive audience and no upkeep of the store is necessary as we don't have a choice.
It's a huge store, and with parking underneath what is not to like? It's great. Just remember your Nectar card!

Very bad experience the manger gurav he is very angry he don’t know how to talk he said am the manger I don’t have staff if you don’t have staff than close the store why you are working . No communication skills I don’t why he is here as a manager.

It is a large store with a large selection of household items, books, clothing, cleaning products and personal care, food, etc. The times I have visited the store, I have only met friendly employees and they have everything you need for everyday life and then some.

The toilets are so bad every time that I go. I have decided to start taking photos and upload them each time. I've missed a few, but it's so consistent that I'm sure there'll be plenty of them.
I either have to wait 10-15 minutes for my click and collect shopping, or, more likely, it will already be out, and my frozen items will have melted.
I have rocked up 10-15 minutes before closing a couple of times. Wanting to buy 1 or 2 items at the last minute. They close their doors early to stop people from getting in. They also make it super difficult to navigate in the last hour of being open.
Clearly badly managed. Feels like customers are burdens. The little interaction I've had with staff hasn't been great. Only use it because it's my closest superstore. Would love to have another option, as it would be pretty difficult to be worse than this.
Very large store, neat, spacious and staffed with polite people.

I just bought a steak pie by sainsbury's
When I goy it home its completely ruined the pie is smashed and the packaging is damaged like they all are in the shop I've found countless items broken or packaging damaged when I asked the manager about in December he told me not to come back again

The lady at the tills calling us to go to them was VERY rude and was shouting at people telling them to hurry up, Asking what they are doing and being very agressive towards all the customers. Don’t go here if u want to be abused by evil workers (Seriously though)

The staff and security guys in Abbey Wood Sainsbury’s are ridiculous and provide the worst experience! They stop my family, who was holding a crying baby, because they want to wait outside while I was paying at the checkout. The security search our shopping trolley without giving proper and rational reason. My family is not good at English could not stop him as he was holding a baby! The security claimed he was suspicious just because he exited at the “Exit” gate without buying anythin (because I did and I was paying!) and ignored our crying baby and stopped him from leaving. How considerate he was, it really disgusted me.
The other time was that the staff stopped me and my family after we complete the payment. She did just because we carried a big trolley but only buying a few pounds of products. Come on, what the heck!? How logical and educated their staff is! This shop didn’t allow their customers to shop from other shops before entering their shop! So, if you want to have an enjoyable shopping experience, never come to this shop again!
Parking is beneath the shop so lifts or travelator is necessary, not great if you just want to run in for 1 or 2 things! Otherwise standard Sainsbury's syore
I passed by as I only went to the shop under Bethel Mini-Mart to supply my Ginger Drink.
Lovely new Sainsbury's, just outside abbey wood train station. The store is bigger than it looks outside. It sells everything from clothes, home stuff and food. Great staff.

Helpful staff and good customer service apart from few exception. There are less staff for customer support, they are mostly busy to carry out some task, customer support on the shop floor seems very low in priority. This is basically same in all the supermarkets in the UK.

Close to the bus-stop and the train station. It has a big car park, bakery. The café is closed now.

ATM for US dollar and Euro and British pound.

They fixed the escalator but it comes with VERY ANOYING caution in mechanical voice and continuous beeping at the entrance.
--------
Over time the customer service is hitting the new low due to staff shortage or probably because of cost-saving attitude of the management.

Customers services all around the shop is sloppy. Due to shop reorganisation may products are moved. Firstly it is annoying if the products are not on the place where it supposed to be, secondly the employees are very reluctant to find the product , they will give the row number to find it. As if we go there to play games. Tills are closed ahead of time. I started to  fell indifferent about the shoplifters who exploits this system.

The management close the entrance what most customers use half an hour before closing time. Some staffs are rushing  around to go home, some are very vigorously refelling the shelf  before closing.
Aside from hating how you have to have a nectar card to pay normal prices. There's also the problem that they have one of most horrible smelling toilets in the country 🤢

Shop in there on a regular basis the store is great most of the staff are lovely but there's a few unhelpful and rude staff but the good ones outnumber them , my only complaint is parking issues the carpark is always used for the station it got worse when the Elizabeth line opened have to drive round trying to find a space usually right over the back which isn't great when you do a big shop why don't Sainsbury's stop this from happening.

Sadly this store gets more and more decrepit and shabby - escalator walkways regularly not working and take weeks to be repaired; lifts regularly not working; difficult if shopping as the store opens in the morning due to shelves / refrigerated areas all blocked for restocking and floor cleaner racing round at speed.  If a store opens at a certain time, then it should be open for business not for work which should be nearly finished on the shop floor.  I really feel sorry for staff as they are lovely, but they are working in an environment which is obviously not cared about.  As this is the only store within walking distance of hundreds of residents, I assume the community is considered a captive audience and no upkeep of the store is necessary as we don't have a choice.
It's a huge store, and with parking underneath what is not to like? It's great. Just remember your Nectar card!

Very bad experience the manger gurav he is very angry he don’t know how to talk he said am the manger I don’t have staff if you don’t have staff than close the store why you are working . No communication skills I don’t why he is here as a manager.

It is a large store with a large selection of household items, books, clothing, cleaning products and personal care, food, etc. The times I have visited the store, I have only met friendly employees and they have everything you need for everyday life and then some.

The toilets are so bad every time that I go. I have decided to start taking photos and upload them each time. I've missed a few, but it's so consistent that I'm sure there'll be plenty of them.
I either have to wait 10-15 minutes for my click and collect shopping, or, more likely, it will already be out, and my frozen items will have melted.
I have rocked up 10-15 minutes before closing a couple of times. Wanting to buy 1 or 2 items at the last minute. They close their doors early to stop people from getting in. They also make it super difficult to navigate in the last hour of being open.
Clearly badly managed. Feels like customers are burdens. The little interaction I've had with staff hasn't been great. Only use it because it's my closest superstore. Would love to have another option, as it would be pretty difficult to be worse than this.
Very large store, neat, spacious and staffed with polite people.

I just bought a steak pie by sainsbury's
When I goy it home its completely ruined the pie is smashed and the packaging is damaged like they all are in the shop I've found countless items broken or packaging damaged when I asked the manager about in December he told me not to come back again
No fridges or freezers working, no in store information about this problem before you start shopping. 24.072025
Good store. Had what I needed. Staff definitely helped when i realised my mistake at the self check out. They've got stairs etc to get to the store. They have a car park as well. Transport nearby.
A good store but to many people loitering about in car park and entrance.
A nice clean and inviting store. Stocks a full range of items. Also the staff were all friendly and helpful.
One of the waste service for the delivery drivers they not responding properly don't take orders for the store waste of time 😡🤬🤬🤬

The lady at the tills calling us to go to them was VERY rude and was shouting at people telling them to hurry up, Asking what they are doing and being very agressive towards all the customers. Don’t go here if u want to be abused by evil workers (Seriously though)

The staff and security guys in Abbey Wood Sainsbury’s are ridiculous and provide the worst experience! They stop my family, who was holding a crying baby, because they want to wait outside while I was paying at the checkout. The security search our shopping trolley without giving proper and rational reason. My family is not good at English could not stop him as he was holding a baby! The security claimed he was suspicious just because he exited at the “Exit” gate without buying anythin (because I did and I was paying!) and ignored our crying baby and stopped him from leaving. How considerate he was, it really disgusted me.
The other time was that the staff stopped me and my family after we complete the payment. She did just because we carried a big trolley but only buying a few pounds of products. Come on, what the heck!? How logical and educated their staff is! This shop didn’t allow their customers to shop from other shops before entering their shop! So, if you want to have an enjoyable shopping experience, never come to this shop again!
Parking is beneath the shop so lifts or travelator is necessary, not great if you just want to run in for 1 or 2 things! Otherwise standard Sainsbury's syore
I passed by as I only went to the shop under Bethel Mini-Mart to supply my Ginger Drink.
